title: Untitled (Scatter Piece)

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of pressed wool felt, steel, zinc-plated steel, copper-clad steel, lead, aluminum, and brass.

dimensions: Dimensions vary with installation; approximately 60 square meters (650 squared ft.)
medium_display: Pressed wool felt, steel, zinc-plated steel, copper-clad steel, lead, aluminum, and brass
credit_line: Through prior gift of Mr. and Mrs. Edwin Hokin; Contemporary Art Discretionary Fund; purchased with funds provided by an anonymous donor and Janet and Craig Duchossois; N.W. Harris Purchase Prize,  Wilson L. Mead Trust, and Mr. and Mrs. Frank G. Logan funds; purchased with funds provided by Judith Neisser; Watson F. Blair Prize, Emilie L. Wild, William H. Bartles, and Laura Slobe Memorial Prize funds
publication_history:
Annette Michaelson, Robert Morris, exh. cat. (
Washington D.C.: Corcoran Gallery of Art, 1969), 66, cat. 37 (ill.), 95.

New York, Leo Castelli Gallery, Red and Black Black and Red: Robert Morris, exh. cat. (New York: Castelli, 2014), 13, image 13 (color ill.), image 14 (ill.), 14.

Jeffrey Weiss, with contributions by Bernard Ceysson, Courtney Fiske, Simone Forti, Caroline A. Jones, and Alexandre Quoi, Robert Morris: The Perceiving Body, exh. cat. (Milan: Mousse Publishing, 2020), 2-3 (ill.), 18, 19, fig. 2 (ill.), 20, 77 (ill.), 84, 86, fig. 6 (ill.), 87, 89-89, fig. 7 (color ill.), 97, 195, 198.
exhibition_history:
Castelli Warehouse, New York, Continuous Project Altered Daily, Mar. 1–22, 1969, no cat. 

Washington D.C., Corcoran Gallert of Art, Robert Morris, Nov. 24–Dec. 28, 1969, cat. 37; Detroit Institute of Arts, Jan. 8–Feb. 8, 1970 (Washington only).

Luxembourg City, Musée d’art moderne Grand-Duc Jean, Robert Morris: The Perceiving Body, Feb 8–June 1, 2020 (extendted from Apr. 26, 2020 due to COVID-19), no cat. no.; Musée d’art moderne contemporain de Saint-Étienne Métropole,  July 1–Nov. 1, 2020 (rescheduled from June 6–Sept. 27, 2020 due to COVID-19).
provenance_text: The artist; sold through Leo Castelli Gallery, New York, to the Art Institute Chicago, 2014.
